channel.title: Dd on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Dd on Notes

item.title: Generate Random File
item.description: How to generate a file of a defined size (ex. 100MB) with random content binary file: dd if=/dev/urandom of=file.dat bs=1M count=100 or dd if=/dev/urandom of=file.dat bs=`echo $((100*1024*1024))` count=1 dd if=/dev/urandom of=file.dat bs=1024 count=`echo $((100*1024))` bs – block size in bytes text file: base64 /dev/urandom | dd of=file.txt bs=1M count=100 iflag=fullblock base64 represents (encodes) binary data using printable ASCII characters empty file: dd if=/dev/zero of=file.
